comments.body: I like it I like it a lot!
maybe they could occasionally  throw snowballs or eggs at other vilagers
Thats actually a good idea ngl
I designed banners with the miners need cool shoes website to give ideas as to what they could look like.
perhaps dont change the villager's entire appearance. just the clothing. though it would look kinda cool if some villagers had the magenta eyes in my opinion.
awsome
You could also get an achievement/advancement/PS4 equivalent called something like ‚Äúyou don‚Äôt belong here‚Äù for breeding villagers in both dimensions
nether villagers should have chains on them and end villages should have enderman skin

24 may be a bit much, but increasing would be nice.

Perhaps they'll do more trades before closing it up for in demand stuff (increasing supply to meet demand) or perhaps stuff they are having trouble selling (because they're desperate to move it).

I do agree that 12 trades, of EVERYTHING they may have is not enough for most jobs though.

I think it would look better like this.

Level 1: 3

Level 2: 4

Level 3: 6

Level 4: 8

Level 5: No need more restock

While it is a bit boring to level up at the beginning and this restricted restocking times, this makes the final reward of being able to exchange infinitely more satisfying.

I definitely don't like that they've 'fixed' the infinite restocking back to twice a day in 1.15 snapshots. Limiting restocking to their working period during the day seems like a sufficient limitation to me, especially for a fully leveled villager as someone else noted here.

i will agree with this point, 1.15 fixed the infinite restock which is kinda ridiculous to only have 2 restocks per game day.

 

it should be like one from two:

1. restocking twice a day if no disabled trades, otherwise they will instantly restock when they work on their table again. 

2. 8x the maximum trades before disabling. (like you can now trade up from 16 times to 128 times)

Wandering traders sell all overworld plants I can think of, at least blocks or items that allow you to get them. But there's no trade for bamboo. Even cocoa beans, that are found on the same biome as bamboo is available. This clearly seems more like an unintended thing.
I'm playing the bedrock edition of minecraft (I checked that this also affects it) in an old type world. It would be super important to get bamboo..
so weird that this isn't a real trade
As a Minecraft skyblock player this would be an epic adition, and becouse they have added the trades in the past I think that they should do the same for the other plants and stuff

With bamboo getting it's own wood type in 1.20, it would make sense if the wandering trader would sell bamboo just like the other saplings.
Especially handy in Skyblock or superflat challenges

they should allow the wandering trader to sell bamboo because of the 1.20 update bamboo can be used as a wood, and every other source of wood with the exception of the nether woods are obtainable through the trader via saplings or the proposed change of the trader actually selling wood in the villager rework.

I suggest to add bamboo as a trade AND t√≤ add some plants that are unavailable in worlds like superflat or skyblock, at exemple adding glowberries, sweet berries, cocoa beans AND most importantly Bamboo, since its needed to build as a wood and scaffolding.
and superflat worlds
FR like, they are supposed to wander around the world, if they cannot find bamboo, how should I?, The game should stop relying on jungles as the only way to get my favourite type of wood

I agree. That would be a good idea, but (not completely sure) I think suffocating Inside the block would be against most of Minecraft's codes. Maybe it should stun them instead? also, will it be the same as a iron golem and protect villages or be made with obsidian blocks instead of iron ones?? p.s. Sorry for any offense or over-the-top questions

:)

CrazierCrown, the stun idea would be a good adjustment. And as all golems are made for, they will attack any hostile mobs, protecting villagers in the process. Last of all, yes, it is made from a T shape of obsidian blocks. I also thought about making this T recipe-shape one block tall than normal, as I envisioned the dark golem being taller than the iron golem, but just as slim, if not slimmer.
It should look like the texture of obsidian and purple eyes.
The golem as very slow

This mob seems a little to over powerd when you sy it slam mobs in the ground and then they suffocate, will this be an enemy or helper to the player because just because it slams enemy's into the ground does not mean it will happen to us.
Perhaps guarding end cities?

Traveling and searching takes memory space and in infinite worlds you could be traveling for quite some time, i personally have run out of memory space. A wandering trader would save this from happening as fast

Perhaps the wandering trader should be ‚Äúconvinced‚Äù to let you order items once you‚Äôve bought say 5 emeralds worth of stuff? And fro every five emeralds spent there would be one extra item in stock that you order...

to repeat a bit clearer. If you buy 5 emeralds worth of loot then you can ask for a blaze rod once you‚Äôve bought 1 blaze rod that‚Äôs it the trade gets maxed. if you spend 10 emeralds on loot the trade will have 2 blaze rods to sell... etc
Nice! Would definitely fix the problem of the horrible trades they give right now.
I am game for that
You do know that multiplayer exists?
its kinda like that map with this AI called albert.DanTDM did it once
Good idea and this should be togglable. Should be available in multiplayer too I think though.

I've tried adding this through addons. It's not easy.

You got my vote!
i wanted this for years üòÉ and its finny happing

AI players should be possible because not everyone has online access. There should be an OPTION to add 1-5 more players and to make them fight you (evil) or follow you(good).

If you want them to fight you, you can set a difficulty, they search for you to kill you, the higher the difficulty the better loot you can get they should also respawn in the overworld within 4,000 blocks from you or the portal that you entered, they should reswawn in 30 min. They can also flatten out a small area and build a small house.

If you chose them to follow you, then you can give them commands like to help mine, draw a map, follow to help fight with you, you can also control their inventory, make them go fishing, trade with you, cut down a certain amount of trees, or just tell them to wander off. You have to give them the tools to access certain options, when the tool breaks then they stop what they were doing and come back to the actual player for the next command. They are very bad at doing things when you start off, as time goes on, they gather exp, Their exp+half of the actual players exp= skill level, the higher the skill level the better they are at doing things, at first they mine slowly and attack with barely any damage and take a long time to start a swing or charge a bow, when their skill level is higher they become quicker and better at doing certain tasks, they might also get more command options. If they die it takes 30 minutes to respawn, they drop only their exp and inventory.
You got my vote !
You know what else this could be good for? Keeping locations rendered. You could have an AI player maybe stay near a certain location like a farm, in order to keep the farm going while you're away
2 PLAYING SUPPER

There is already AIs. Like Entity303, Two-Headed Alex, Can't Sleep, The Half Eaten Sheep, Blood Golem, The Thing, Giant Steve, Frozen Skeleton, and more. Just kidding. I'd like an AI who's not hacking and frying your PC.
The nether isn‚Äôt hard enough, but, it might be better and more scary and harder. (Which isn‚Äôt a bad thing! :3) I agree! I voted! :3 Nice details!

Love the Gate Keeper, but what about placing him in Nether Fortresses.  They are kind of unused you only go there for blaze and wither skeleton spawns and maybe the loot. Maybe they can add another mini boss too called the Fortress Baron or perhaps he's an npc that we can trade with.
Interesting. Honestly I hadn‚Äôt even considered a mini boss for the fortresses. Perhaps the fortresses are due for a main room of some sorts? Mini boss arena?
Similar to what I was thinking
You are right! Even after nether update it is still not hard enough, this is a perfect addition.
He always plays music from the jukebox in his house.
Maybe even swords or axes, for sword swallowing and axe juggling.

That's a great idea! And to add on there could be a way to cure the zombie piglins. Perhaps a new type of potion with nether based ingredients and a golden carrot. The carrot since these guys are based off of pigs and the pigs eat carrots. This let's the village see that the player has no ill will.
Take my upvote
That would also add more depth to the reason why Piglins run away from Zombie Piglins. I like it!
Mah hart
like the idea! very heart warming for minecraft to!
They should have beards.

I like the idea, though trading blocks seems extreme. Maybe shards or crystals for an emerald each? I am also curious about what their workstation would be. I would love to have seafaring villagers, and these accidental ones seem to fit pretty well!
Maybe they should spawn in randomly in the world too, as if they have drifted in from somewhere you don't know and spawns in places that you have already explored too.

Modification: Instead of being a new profession, its just a fisherman. He spawns on a shipwreck, but only the first time you fish the shipwreck. He rewards you with hero of the village if you bring him back
but a boat only holds 2? how are you gonna bring them home?
I imagine the houses either being built into the mountain or standing on stilts.

Given that there are new biomes like the Mountain Valley, I'd like to see villages have the option to spawn there. And as someone also suggested Mountain Temples. That too would be cool with a Shangri-La look.
I don't see new villagers being added especially ones that can effect the world but having custom villages for mountain's would be cool.  not sure what it would bring to the game.
This would be amazing.
They could model them after towns around the Himalayas and place a stupa on the central square :)
This would be a really good idea because there are villages for like every other biome.
it should spawn naturally
399656159471 no it shouldn't spawn naturally, I don't my house be covered in blocks of eternal screaming.
They should add him on April 1st

I love the ragdoll concept of him tho

But I don't want to hurt such a majestic creation
As long as he doesn't eat my world save files and can only be summoned with commands, then I don't see a problem with it.
Imagine this tho, Mojang adds mobbo but its just steeve with hair from the end of the video
Yeah, he should be an easter egg, that would be a nice funny touch
Why not add him as a skin you can make in the Character Creator?

It shouldn't spawn naturally, but maybe instead of just commands (not everyone is good at those, myself included), you can build-spawn it (like Iron Golems or the Wither). It could be some combination of pink wool and magma blocks, maybe. 

I definitely agree that it should be the player's choice to deal with Mobbo since it would get very annoying to deal with it spitting lava and turning everything into blocks of eternal screaming. It would also be a great prank to pull on people!
Good idea, bit confusing but good idea. Would there be a villager trainee and would the villagers have weapons cause otherwise everyone would choose Illiger
It is a good idea, but the illager trading should be far worse than the villager trading, else nobody would choose the villagers.

I really really really enjoy this idea! This would be an incredible content boost for the update. My notes:
- The Trainee should be racially ambiguous (greyish-pink skin?) if he's to be taken to either a village or an outpost.
- The kid ought to fight monsters with you, albeit somewhat poorly so you'd have to defend him.
- I don't know if trading with the illagers is right. It ought to be something that inducts the player into the pillaging lifestyle, rewarding them for the emeralds & loot they bring home. Also up the iron golem spawn rate (I've never actually seen it myself in my villages) and give the villagers ways to actually defend themselves. That way pillaging villages becomes a challenge to consider.

I actually had an idea really similar to this, minus the trainee part! I'm gonna put up some of my own ideas:

 

-All golems, except ones spawned by people working with illagers should attack them.

-You should be able to start a raid on the village, and illagers will throw items at you if you win, similar to players with hero of the village effect. I feel this would be a better replacement for the "trade" as that doesnt feel like an illager thing to do.

-You should also have ways to lose rep, such as by killing villagers, golems, illagers, ravagers, winning/losing raids etc. The climb upwards should be exponential and exponentially easier to fall down.

-Let us ride Ravagers!!!!!

-Illagers should protect you if you get hurt, similar to how they protect their own.

-There should also be some unique bonuses you get the more you help illagers, like a slight crossbow buff that helps make up for the differences between the two.

I've tried to add a similar post. But I have an idea, that the player can trade with Illagers by Ruby - new ore (not new, if you know what I mean). Following which Illagers become peaceful, and Villagers (as well as Golems) hostile mobs.
I think that the first trade level must be like with Piglins. The player must hold a Ruby in his arm (because of what Illagers won't attack the player) and then trow it. Maybe next steps can have similar system with Villagers.
Also after selecting a side a Ravager can be tamed and ridden by the player. However it will be much more difficult to tame a Ravager than a Horse. It requires a different type of saddle. Feeding two tamed Ravagers (Enchanted?) Golden Apple activates love mode, causing them to mate and produce a foal.
The player can learn from Evokers how to summon Vexes as well. It could be a new line of development - Magic (do not confuse with Brewing).

I was just going to suggest something like this. In real life, some criminals don't want to keep on the path of evil, and change for the good, I thought they should implement something like that into Minecraft. But this is a better idea than the one I thought up. Good work! :D Personally, I favor the Illagers, but I use commands to make them peaceful. I prefer the Illagers' appearance over the Villagers'. But that's just me. ‚ïÆ(‚îÄ‚ñΩ‚îÄ)‚ï≠
I'm not sure this would be added to the base game, but this would be an excellent mod.
I agree 100%
Jungle villages could be treehouse villages and swamp villages could be built over water

I agree, though personally I think they should sell different kinds of maps than cartographers, so they're both useful.
Maybe maps to the nearest villages, or even nearest biomes, as there's no way to locate a particular biome in survival, without lucky exploration.
Maybe dungeons and/or Strongholds
They should trade locater maps to all sorts of places. Can someone please check out my use for the enderdragon egg? My large paragragh has all the conditions!

I like that idea. I find the traders don't offer a lot of interesting items a lot of the time, and I would really like to be able to buy maps.

Further, when the trader despawns, he leaves his llamas behind, and they just linger around, meaning if I spend a few hours at my fort, I easily end up with a dozen llamas making noise and climbing around on rooftops, this is really annoying, and I wish they would despawn with him.
I agree, also biomes like Mushroom islands (which i have literally never seen on java edition before)
Nether fortress maps?

This would be a really fun way to make every Trader a treat! I think it would be cool if he offered different locations from dolphins and cartographers‚Äîdungeons, desert wells, desert temples,  that sort of thing! He could even give maps to random biomes, giving you a way to potentially track down obscure biomes like mushroom plains and coral reefs!
Yes, that would be VERY good. The Wandering Trader could be a rare villager who sells maps of biomes.
wandering traders should give maps to random biomes like one spawns and sells a jungle explorer map
This idea needs more votes
They should exclusively sell a map to the nearest village.

I thought about that idea as well, and liked it very much!

maybe the wandering trader could sell random normal maps (like treasure maps) with no indicator of the players location, but a structure located and named (like he randomly found the structure on his way) (but with a low chance of lets say 10 % per trader)

maybe he could also sell maps with specific biomes, with the players indicator on the map (with that, finding biomes would be much easier and the trader much more interesting) (when coming to the lore, he could have wandered around and randomly find the location, where you have the chance to copy it on a empty map)

I like this! Especially because the prisoner following you gives the impression that you are rescuing them, but also could be a useful mechanic when advanced players want easy-transport villagers! They wouldn't spawn consistently, so they would still have to be found and transported, and brought to where the player wants and healed in order to be useful, but they would be slightly easier to handle and not as ridiculously annoying. Great job with this idea!

Another idea would be unlocking an advancment when healing, or putting the work station on a prisioner villager. The advancement should be called "Prision Riot" or maybe "A succeseful escape".

When giving the villager a job, it should be giving the same discounts as the healed zombie villager.

maybe there woould be a new illager that would be in his or hers cell and hit them but the villager has natural regen so woujld heal until the next hit but if you give it a job it has no more natural regen.
Kill all Illager and creat Villager Mansion!
what do you mean by a "dark oak texture"?
By a "dark oak texture" I mean a dark oak variant of the villager clothing.

This is an awful change, only result is to make villager trading unfun. It seems like an attack on people whose play styles involve building trading halls and working towards having cheapest trades for all the books. Just like building a farm, this takes effort already and a lot of pre work to get the expensive resources to cure villagers. If this is op, so is every other megafarm that is built. If people don‚Äôt want to get enchantments from villagers, just don‚Äôt. Just like you can choose to go mining for iron instead of building an iron farm.
Games are supposed to be fun, not frustrating because of nerfs

Yes it would be so annoying if Mojang made villagers bad. I hope mojang knows that if they do this nerf they will probably lose a good chunk of their player base. Villagers are what supply probably at least half of most average to dedicated players‚Äôs resources. If they do this Minecraft will become an overall less enjoyable game.
This sounds interesting.  What would this creature look like, though (before you attack it)?  Maybe a sort of player-shaped bluish thing with no face, but possibly glowing eyes?
It could look like a human but it would be like blue or red or something and if you have special skin geometry it would have that too
Yes not a bad idea but what will it look life at first
That would be pretty cool. It would add a new challenge in regaining your stuff and keep it from despawning.
just make it a zombie that only appears when you die to a zombie

I agree, the grind to make any use of the villagers will now be hilarious difficult, and getting the best armor and tools may be impossible. With these updates being about self expression and enhancing the different styles of play, I feel like this is very contradictive to that theme. Making not just a styled, but a powerful and personalized enchanted armor is a form of expression that predated these armor trims! Why does it need to be so ridiculously difficult to get that now. Not to mention, I know may players who aren't Minecraft combat professionals, so they can't beat the game without the best stuff. It's out of there reach. If this nerf is going to go through, then there needs to be some major buffs too, such as removing the to expensive mark on an anvil, reducing the do price of combing books and gear, restoring villagers top lvl enchantments, and making moving villagers easier

I totally agree, if a Villager rebalance is supposed to happen then the anvil and Enchanting table must receive a complete overhaul, otherwise the game will become to time consuming for many people (including myself).
I agree, and especially players who are not yet familiar with the game may have considerable difficulties.

I completely agree. I think this update will just make villager trading more of a grind than it needs to be. It‚Äôs already a pretty brutal grind to get the enchantments. I think this is going to make things a lot more difficult for small servers and single player worlds.

"i shouldnt have to get a villagers from a jungle"

Exactly. Imagine thinking that lugging around villagers to different biomes is a fun way to play.

 

"just to get unbreaking 2, oh yeah i forgot to say that its unbreaking 2, not 3, which makes making enchanted tools more difficult"

Also, Why make it unnecessarily difficult to achieve the higher-level enchantments? If the devs want to make it so that someone is enticed to get the highest level of enchantments, then why arbitrarily limit it? If I want to go around the world for books, I'll do that, and I've done that in the past. I always knew trading with villagers was an option, but most times I preferred exploring anyways and seeing the books as an extra bonus.

TO THE DEVS: Please don't do this to the player base. Please don't turn into other studios that pigeonhole the players into one pathway for progression! Minecraft is supposed to have multiple ways to play and complete the game (if they even choose to complete it). Why get rid of the player's ability to play in their SINGLEPLAYER game the way they want? Leave the multiple paths open to the player's interest. If you feel that some biomes you have spent a lot of time updating aren't getting enough attention, then make them more enticing to visit and live in using a unique way. Do not punish those who have found playstyles they have grown accustomed to (unless it's truly game-breaking and ruins the fun for other people in multiplayer).
Just use the enchantment table. In addition, you do not need maximum levels for a comfortable game.
Why would you want to get unbreaking from a villager, it's a really common enchant

Unbreaking is important because it's a rare enchant on books. On equipment sure, but for Elytras, Shields, hoes and shears it's not really an enchantable option. 

I think the idea was fine but the nerfs are too hard. The average player is not going to know how to access the nether roof, much less even know that you can get above it. Along with the expanded biomes for subpar enchants, it's far too much that you probably will never want/need to use librarians other than for paper. 

The armorer nerfs I'm down with. Needing diamonds to buy the gear is fine, what's not fine is how weak the enchants are. Like what's the point of getting blast protection 1? We are all just going to use a grindstone for it. 

This heavily impacts the normal player base as they probably don't even know how to make an end/gold farm to get quick access to exp making their grind even more difficult. All I know now is that priests are about to be the most used villager purely for lapis and the librarians for bookshelves so we can mass enchant and make inventory management even worse.
I love this idea, but will these jockeys fly lower than normal phantoms?
Genius! This should be in the game.
Anything riding a phantom doesn't make sense they burn in the daylight then only spawn if you are tired

Could you clarify about the potion thing, what I take it to be is a potion that bounces along and follows you until it explodes the effect everywhere. Also the creation of the potion should be a sputter in the ingredients part of the brewing stand and the splash potions in the bottom bit. Once it brews it'll become the heatseaking potion. It seems more intuitive.

Also, Mc Rat, I can understand trying to protect the lore of minecraft, but the phantom has multiple lores attached to it, my idea is that the phantom is a creature attracted to insomnia. But I think that the new mob is too good to pass up.

Yup you got my vote.

Lore or not, this should be an interesting enemy to deal with.
We need more Illager mobs sooo YES
this is incredible and so creative! really love this idea

The only way the phantom spawns is already known. It usually happens when you are hiding from other mobs, you are mining for a while, (which is a horrible spot to fight a phantom) or you have no bed and are looking for a home. If you are like that, then you wouldn't have anything strong enough to fight it. With the mining possibility, lava could be above you and then it explodes. The scenarios will be too rough.
It‚Äôs a nice concept, pretty interesting
That was a great idea, we need an illager that can fly and have explosive weopons, this guy will be hard to beat
I like the concept but I would call it a Potioneer
a Potioneer is basically an alchemist even in harry potter. unless of course, it's the development of potions that makes an alchemist in which case I guess you are correct
No.  Potions should only be accessible through the Nether.
great idea, I hate going into the fortresses cuz of blazes
I think this would be a good way to re-implement the neutral hooded Witch from 18w50a.
AKA Witch doctor AKA Alcemist
good idea, having only evil witches perpetuates negative stereotypes
Good
Ok
How about the pullover captain or an evoker?

I think the horn, for when obtained, can be used for calls like confusing pillagers during a raid because the horn is like a special code that makes the pillagers know when and where to act. so when their are two horn blowing, your's and the captian's, the raid will get confused. also I say the horn can be used to make sounds when you press a button on whatever platform you have. I also would want the horn to be activated and sound when it is hooked up to a redstone circuit.
Horns should be able to scare pillagers away. It should also act like a bell for villagers.
I agree. Some instruments in minecraft wouldn't be a bad idea either.
This would be very nice and add some realism. Voted.
They should add both as like they are both good trades

Have them sell both bundles and saddles. Also, from what I've seen on the minecraft wiki, they don't sell any enchanted items (and so far I haven't seen my leatherworkers sell any enchanted items) so I don't bother setting up a cauldron in villages because non-enchanted leather is pretty useless.
How do you open bundles?
I think this is a good idea, but they would have to be exorbitantly expensive, perhaps on par with enchanted diamond gear, so players don‚Äôt just get them for basically free.
No caso seria algo como, 'carpinteiro'.
This idea is creative and original! I like it!
Maybe a villager job being Woodcutter/Carpenter

I 100% agree, with all the new professions for villagers and alternative ways through trading to get various resources, I feel that the various wood blocks and trees have been left out. 

Sure a wandering trader can come by and you can get saplings from them and a fletcher has the stick trade for emeralds.  But an "arborist" or "wood cutter" could trade for raw wood materials for emeralds and at higher levels work as a "carpenter" and offer more finished wood products, fence materials, slabs, ladders. stairs, planks, etc for emeralds.  Much like the Mason that gives access to glazed terracotta's at higher levels of trading, 

Not everyone enjoys cutting down trees for days or building large redstone contraptions to "farm" wood blocks for large building projects :)  This would provide another element to the village system for a resource that wasn't properly included in the villager update.

I think an ideal for this would have two new professions: Carpenter & Gardener.

The woodworking carpenter fills a niche with wood products, and a gardener could fill the role of arborist whilst also taking care of more than just the trees. They could create planters, tend gardens, pick flowers, sell dyes, etc.
It would be good if they sold different plants
